definitions.title: n. m.
definitions.body: eunuch (NH id., Targum [[סָרִיסָא]], Syr. soriyso0 (all c. vb. denom. = emasculate), OAram. [[סרסא]] Lzb:331 Cook:86; Ar. sarisun, sariysun (vb. warisa be impotent), Kam Frey (not Lane); prob. foreign word; acc. to Jen:ZA vii. 174 = As. šarêši (rîši), he who is the head, chief, cf. Brock:Lex 239 b Dl:HWB 694 (ša-riš ?), Zim:ZMG liii. 1899, 116; eunuch being specialized meaning; in any case Ar. is Aram. loan-word);—abs. ´[[ס]] 1Ki 22:9 + 7 t.; cstr. [[סְרִיס]] Ge 37:36 + 3 t.; pl. [[סָרִיסִים]] 2Ki 9:32 + 17 t.; cstr. [[סְרִיסֵי]] Ge 40:7 + 4 t.; sf. [[סָרִיסָיו]] Ge 40:2 + 4 t., [[סָרִיסֶ֫יהָ]] Es 4:4; —eunuch, of Pharaoh Ge 37:36, Ge 40:2, Ge 40:7 (all E), married Ge 39:1 (R:JE); of Isr. kings 1Sa 8:15 (predict.), 1Ki 22:9 = 2Ch 18:8, 2Ki 8:6, 2Ki 9:32 (all of N. Isr.); 1Ch 28:1 (in David's time). 2Ki 23:11, 2Ki 24:12, 2Ki 24:15 cf. Je 29:2, also Je 34:19, Je 38:7, Je 41:16 (all in Judah; so likewise) 2Ki 25:19 (military officer) = Je 52:25; of Bab. kings 2Ki 20:18 = Is 39:7 (predict.); ascribed to Nebuch. in Dn, [[רַב סָרִיסָיו]] Da 1:3, [[שַׂר הַסָּרִיסִים]] v:Da 1:7, v:Da 1:8, v:Da 1:9, v:Da 1:10, v:Da 1:11, v:Da 1:18; to king of Persia in Est Es 1:10, Es 1:12, Es 1:15 + 9 t. Est; promises made to eunuchs Is 56:3, Is 56:4. (Term never used in law codes; on contrary cf. exclusion of [[פְּחוּעַ דַּכָּא]], and [[כְּרוּת שָׁפְכָה]] De 23:2 [v. Dr:ad loc.], also [[מְרוֹחַ אָָשֶׁח]] Le 21:20.)—[[רַב־סָרִיס]] is title of high military officer 2Ki 18:17 (As.), Je 39:3, Je 39:13 (Bab.).—Vid. further, Thes Smith:DB Art. ‘ Eunuch, ’ Di:Ge 39, 1 Dr Dt:23, 1.
